    core/ App

    .new App(modulesopt)

    This component is used to prepare a world scene, setup physics, camera, renderer and all other things that you usually do before making meshes.

    Source:
    • core/App.js, line 6
    Parameters:
    Name Type Attributes Default Description
    modules Array <optional>
    		 []

    Array of Modules

    Extends ModuleSystem

    Members

    .loops :Array

    Array of loops that are executed by this app.

    Source:
    • core/App.js, line 50

    .simulate :Boolean

    Same as .updateEnabled, but for physics. Defines if physics is simulated each frame.

    Source:
    • core/App.js, line 57

    .updateEnabled :Boolean

    Defines whether the scene should render or not

    Source:
    • core/App.js, line 18

    Methods

    (static) .addLoop(loop) → {Promise}

    Adds loop to this app.

    Source:
    • core/App.js, line 104
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    loop Object

    the loop to add
    Example

    Adding a loop to an app

    const loop = new Loop(() => {
 // ...
});

const app = new App();

app.addLoop(loop);
loop.start();

    (static) .removeLoop(loop) → {Promise}

    Removes loop from this app.

    Source:
    • core/App.js, line 132
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    loop Object

    the loop to remove

    (static) .start()

    Start rendering loop and physics simulation (if you use version with physics).

    Source:
    • core/App.js, line 44

    (static) .stop()

    Stops rendering loops
